example_quotes: OK. And his taste, any reason to believe there are any changes there?
Well, we've been kind of spoiling him a bit, just giving him ice cream. His throat hurts a little bit and he seems to still like it, so it's hard to tell.
He says his throat hurts, but I don't think it's his chest.

No. We haven't been really feeding him solid meals, it's because he's been sick, we've been trying to give him soup and liquids for the most part because his throat hurts, but he's able to keep them down.
He says his throat hurts, but I don't think it's his chest.

No. We haven't been really feeding him solid meals, it's because he's been sick, we've been trying to give him soup and liquids for the most part because his throat hurts, but he's able to keep them down.
OK, and then in terms of his bowel movements, have things been normal from that standpoint?
Oh yeah, process of potty training him, but no, no real changes.
OK, and then how about changes in his appetite?
Yeah, he's not eating as much but still, we're trying to force food into him to keep his energy up. Most of time he always will be asking for snacks in the afternoon, but now not so much.
OK and any reason for you to think he has chest pain?
He hasn't any sort of chest pain. He says his throat hurts, but I don't think it's his chest.
OK and any complications during the actual delivery?

Yeah, not that I remember like she started going to labor early, like earlier than we expected. We thought it was just a regular contraction and that it will just resolve but she wound up proceeding when we showed up at the hospital
OK and any complications during the actual delivery?

Yeah, not that I remember like she started going to labor early, like earlier than we expected. We thought it was just a regular contraction and that it will just resolve but she wound up proceeding when we showed up at the hospital
OK, and then any confusion or memory loss?
No.
OK, so no diarrhea, no constipation, no blood in the stool?
No.
I was just bringing my son and he's just had cough for the last couple of days.
So the cough, is it consistent? Or does it come and go?
OK, so no diarrhea, no constipation, no blood in the stool?
No.
OK OK, and then any dizziness or fainting spells that you've noticed?
No fainting or dizzy spells, but he's really gassed after he has like a coughing fit and he doesn't want to stand up, he'll just be sitting down or he wants to be held.
Has he had any fevers?
No.
And his vision and hearing are normal?

You know, I haven't gotten him formally assessed yet, but seems to be able to read pretty well from a distance. He's not in school yet, but I haven't noticed anything, and he can hear fine. I think he responds when I call.
OK so no blood as well right?
No blood.
OK, is he more irritable than usual?
Yeah after he has a bad coughing fit, he wants to be soothed and he'll be crying, but it's just more of because he's worn out, I believe he's tired.
OK, and then any confusion or memory loss?
No.
OK, has he had a stuffy or runny nose?
Yeah yeah, that's kind of how it first started three days ago. Maybe had a runny nose. OK, yeah.
Any nausea or vomiting?

No. We haven't been really feeding him solid meals, it's because he's been sick, we've been trying to give him soup and liquids for the most part because his throat hurts, but he's able to keep them down. So no, no nausea, no vomiting.
OK and he's passing gas?
OK yeah I'd say so.
OK, so no diarrhea, no constipation, no blood in the stool?
No.
OK, has he had a stuffy or runny nose?
Yeah yeah, that's kind of how it first started three days ago. Maybe had a runny nose. OK, yeah.
OK so he has a little bit of a sore throat as well?
Yeah.
OK, well, from the sounds of it, he most likely has some sort of viral infection.
We had a little bit of stay in the NICU, just because he was a little bit underweight, but no, nothing really.
How about weight loss?
No weight loss, he's a fairly healthy kid.
And his vision and hearing are normal?
You know, I haven't gotten him formally assessed yet, but seems to be able to read pretty well from a distance.
Any nausea or vomiting?

No. We haven't been really feeding him solid meals, it's because he's been sick, we've been trying to give him soup and liquids for the most part because his throat hurts, but he's able to keep them down. So no, no nausea, no vomiting.
OK any wheeziness?
No, not really. He's able to breathe. I can't really hear him breathing that much. Sometimes at night after a bad cough he'll be really winded.
